snippet: The office of the Special Commissioner of Investigation handled 4,173 complaints, more than double the amount received during the first year of the Bloomberg administration.
abstract: Office of Special Commissioner of Investigation for the Department of Education in New York City received 4,173 complaints in 2012, more than double amount received during 2002, first year of Bloomberg administration; complaints prompted 795 investigations--57 centered on accusations of sexual misconduct by school employees or vendors, majority of them educators with access to children.
lead_paragraph: The office of the Special Commissioner of Investigation handled 4,173 complaints, more than double the amount received during the first year of the Bloomberg administration.
